intro: Cheiranthera tortilis, commonly known as the twisted sand orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiraling inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, with a distinctive, twisted shape. Cheiranthera tortilis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
